item.title: Neenah add a quote by James Baldwin
item.description: "To be a Negro in this country and to be relatively conscious is to be in a rage almost all the time. " -- James Baldwin

item.title: Neenah add a quote by Octavia E. Butler
item.description:
"All that you touch You Change.
All that you Change Changes you.
The only lasting truth is Change.
God is Change." -- Octavia E. Butler

item.title: Neenah add a quote by Alice Walker
item.description: "Be nobody's darling; Be an outcast. Take the contradictions Of your life And wrap around You like a shawl, To parry stones To keep you warm. " -- Alice Walker

item.title: Neenah add a quote by Toni Morrison
item.description: "Freeing yourself was one thing, claiming ownership of that freed self was another." -- Toni Morrison

item.title: Neenah add a quote by Isabel Allende
item.description: "you can tell the deepest truths with the lies of fiction" -- Isabel Allende

item.title: Neenah add a quote by Ntozake Shange
item.description: "i found god in myself and i loved her i loved her fiercely" -- Ntozake Shange

item.title: Neenah add a quote by Simone de Beauvoir
item.description: "All oppression creates a state of war. And this is no exception." -- Simone de Beauvoir

item.title: Neenah add a quote by Walt Whitman
item.description: "Do I contradict myself? Very well, then, I contradict myself; I am large -- I contain multitudes." -- Walt Whitman

item.title: Neenah add a quote by Louisa May Alcott
item.description: "I am not afraid of storms, for I am learning how to sail my ship." -- Louisa May Alcott

item.title: Neenah add a quote by Gabriel García Márquez
item.description: "Human beings are not born once and for all on the day their mothers give birth to them, but ... life obliges them over and over again to give birth to themselves." -- Gabriel García Márquez

item.title: Neenah add a quote by Khalil Gibran
item.description: "Work is love made visible. And if you can't work with love, but only with distaste, it is better that you should leave your work and sit at the gate of the temple and take alms of the people who work with joy" -- Khalil Gibran

item.title: Neenah add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Do not go where the path may lead, go instead where there is no path and leave a trail." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson
